From: "dcoburn" <dcoburn@...>

(Hey, no problem, I feel like I've been away for 65,000,000 just like the
dinosaurs!)
----- Original Message -----
From: "Carnage darkness" <carnage_blood@...>
To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
Sent: Sunday, November 05, 2000 2:59 AM
Subject: Awakening!


>
> ( I do apologize for being so late, I was busy all week. I will try to be
> quicker in my replies.)
>
> ** There was no telling just how long he had been out, but for him to lose
> that much mech-fluid it had to be quite a while.
> Dinobot was just barely hanging onto consciousness, or to what little he
> could grasp with his systems as weak as they were during repair. But it
> wouldn't take long before he would be able to take on the world again.and
> win.
> Not many people knew it, and sometimes other TM2s didn't have the same
> abilities, but every time he was repaired his strength increased for a
short
> time. His systems became faster and more highly placed, faster to process
> data and even map out complicated attack patters before he every used
them.
> However, he had just found that out when he had repaired last, so now he
> knew.
>
> However, he was not quite in the clear yet. His systems would be weaker
now
> when he awoke properly before they became stronger, not use to nearly
> bleeding himself dry due to external and internal wounds.
> But with his repair systems completely activated and functional now, there
> weren't too many worries in his sleepy mind.
>
> Dinobot slightly shifted, his claws losing their grip on the table and
> laying flat against its smooth surface. His mind was beginning to clear
the
> more his repair system took care of the damage, but he still stayed in a
> state which hovered between consciousness and semi-stasis lock.
> But his stomach continued to heave due to the tubes down his throat,
weakly
> choking on them in a futile attempt to bring air into his lungs on his
own.
> But each attempt failed and he just ended up half gagging on the tubes
> instead, his jaws trying to close but unable to due to the tubes again.
>
> With his optics at mere slits the work came into a hazy view, finally
> retreating from the darkness in one single flash of light which was
fringed
> with the green haze of his repair system. That blinding light emitted from
> the outside world almost making him forget what he had seen in his mind,
> deep within it where he had pushed what feelings he ever thought he could
> ever have, ever, for anything or anyone.
> But he didn't forget, not the images, not the reality, not the last words
> spoken to a mind which knew the truth more then he knew his own spark, a
> truth which he was not yet ready to accept quite yet. And if he could ever
> accept it and release that truth, it would change his life forever.
>
> But for now, the world was what occupied his mind as it slowly woke up to
> it, as a small child opening its eyes for the first time and taking in
every
> little detail of its surroundings with awe and wonder.
> However, as unfocused as his world was, he knew what shape.no.person now
> stood over him with a look of the same childlike wonder on her face.
> Watching the green glow of his repair system as it finished up what work
it
> had started, seeing her hazy for reach out and touch one of the green
coils.
> So much information filtered itself into his mother database through that
> coil, just from that single touch.as brief as it had been. He could read
so
> much from that single touch. How old she was, her current health,
> status.thoughts.
> Yes, that one coil could reach into the very recesses of ones mind if they
> dared to stand the pain which was the price for such an experience. But
this
> contact had been so brief that all Dinobot received was a blur of relief
and
> worry, yet both had been something he had expected.
>
> As he looked on at the hazy outline of Tavatron he slightly noticed
> something, something about her that he remembered.the shoulder plate! It
was
> missing! That was what had drawn his attention, the mech-fluid crusted
> shoulder with which Tavatron had lost its plate in the battle with the
> Alliance bot Oblitertron, where he had received his own damage; which had
> almost been the death of him!
> But why wasn't she repaired? He should have been out long enough for her
to
> have gone into one of the CR chambers in the room and repaired.
>
> However, even as he thought such a thing he remembered something that he
> could not quite remember fully, something that had been more of a feeling
> them a sight or a touch which was much easier to recall.
> During the early stages of stasis lock, before he had sensed the tubes had
> been shoved down his throat and into his stomach, he had sensed that
> something which had been there before had left. SomeONE which had been
there
> had left.
> Left him, not just because they had something else to do.but left HIM.
> It was hard to understand, but even as he looked up at Tavatron, somehow,
> someway.he knew that the one which had left had been her. And what
> information that coil had received verified that thought, relaying why she
> had left, where she had gone when she had left, why she had returned and
was
> with him now.
> But she had left him.even with all he had done for her.she had abandoned
> him.
>
> And that was a thought he could not get out of his mind, the fact that
with
> all they had been through, with all the times he had saved her life.when
it
> became her turn to help him.she had backed away and simply abandoned him.
> And believe it or not, through what sheet of ice covered his spark, that
> factor actually HURT him.
> It not only hurt him, but made him feel as if he had been betrayed as
> well.just as he felt betrayed that the Matrix had denied him such a heroes
> death as he so deserved.
> He had trusted her, saved her life numerous times, risking his very spark,
> even held her and shared what small amounts of feelings he had let
> escape.and this was how she repaid him.by abandoning him?!
> That was just something in which he could not come to terms with.
> He wasn't quite angered by it yet, but.well.he didn't exactly know just
what
> to think if it yet. But this was also by cause that his mind had not quite
> woken yet.
>
> Dinobot watched with mixed feelings as Tavatron reached over and gently
> brushed his cheek with her fingers, looking up and into her optics as she
> gazed down at him. And it was then that she suddenly came into view, sharp
> and clear.
> His repair coils unwrapped themselves from his chest and retreated into
his
> spark, the cavity simply sliding shut to shut in the light which guided
his
> very life force.
> And with sudden realism the tubes suddenly made his stomach heave
violently,
> his systems completely repaired and functioning.
>
> With a whining of gears and hydraulics which were not use to sudden
movement
> just after a long period of stillness he sat up and ripped the tubes from
> his throat in one fluid movement, then leaning over the side of the table
to
> retch a bit. His stomach heaved violently a few more times, threatening to
> bring up what energon was in his stomach left to be digested.
> So he simply leaned there on his side, coughing a few times and trying as
> hard as he could to keep the energon down. But then, when his stomach had
> finally calmed a bit and he no longer knew the threat to throw up was
there
> anymore he sat up once again but hung his head a bit, his throat a little
> raw from bringing those tubes up so quick.
>
> Dinobot listened to the silence of the room as he simply sat there,
> recovering from waking up so quickly and performing actions with which his
> body was not yet ready to perform. Breathing deeply he took air into his
> lungs on his own since a few mega-cycles ago. But even as he sat there and
> simply took everything in, Tavatron's little trip from his side swamped
back
> into his main thoughts. But this time he was awake enough to react with a
> reasonable and quite rational feeling, anger.
> But also there was the little matter of that comment she made only moments
> before he had sat up, a comment which needed his much-required response.
> He then turned his optics towards Tavatron with a very deep growl, and
wore
> an expression on his face which was something he was sure Tavatron had
never
> seen in the entire time she had known him.
> A look of complete disrespect.
> And his voice was the exact same, with a tone which would have made a
priest
> look twice**
>
> " Negative. Only a warrior could kill me. Do YOU understand?"
>
